comment: Dr. Nowak is a great instructor who cares for her students' success. She is highly intelligent, but she always tries to water things down for those who may not understand a topic. Class structure was different than usual. 9 exams, but pass/fail with a 70 considered passing (they're hard). Lots of participation pts in HW, in-class, & group project.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: i took her for genetics lab. shes a very easier grader. easy A in my opinion. her lab really helped me understand genetics better. shes very nice and understanding. labs are easy and directions are easy to follow
rating_tags: Group projects--Caring--Gives good feedback

comment: Please take anyone other than her for cell bio. Her tests are insanely difficult, I watch all her lectures and take notes, read the book, and do all the homework and quizzes and she curves her tests and Im still failing. Its like she tries to make her tests as difficult as she possibly can. Im doing better in organic chemistry and calc. AVOID
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Nowak helps make this class a little less stressful and offers a bunch of extra credit. Attendance is not necessary, but I wouldnt miss it. She is a wonderful professor that I would happily take again!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: This class was so difficult for me that I had to drop it after I made 50's on the first two tests. I studied for many many hours and still did horrible. The tests did not seem to be like the information given to study. She seems sweet, but I was not the biggest fan of her teaching methods (just going through powerpoint every single day).
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Nowak is an amazing professor. She only wants the best and for her students to excel. She gives tons of extra credit. Although the class is tough from a content/subject standpoint, Nowak makes it bearable. I would highly recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I have no idea why there would be any bad ratings on this teacher. She is amazing and if you know how Dr. Haack teaches, it is pretty similar. It is anatomy.. you are going to have to study a lot but she really does not try to trick you and gives so much extra credit. I highly recommend. I took her in the summer.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This is a difficult class. If you don't put in the work you're not going to get the grade you want. Professor Nowak gives plenty of extra credit and always makes herself available for questions. Go to the classes and put in the hours. A good grade is possible with her.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I LOVE Dr. Nowak!! I took her for A&P 1 and 2 and got A's in both. Don't get me wrong, anatomy is a VERY difficult class, and no matter who your Prof. is, you will have to study A LOT. But Dr. Nowak made failing her class impossible. She gives so many opportunities for extra credit and is so understanding to us as students. Take her!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This might be the hardest class i have taken. Her tests are near impossible. i studied for up to 3 weeks and still would come back with a F. doing the homework is helpful, but nothing like the tests. unless you memorize the textbook, you are bound to fail this class. she does not curve her tests even if the class average is an F.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I absolutely loved Nowak for BIO 2221. She was very easy to follow, and posts the lectures before class! Print them out, write down things she says, rewrite the notes, study the learning objective, and you've got an A. If you signed up for an 8AM, don't complain about skipping. That's on you. Nowak was great, definitely recommend her!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is so hard, but ultimately being a college student you have to learn it yourself and not study last minute. She gives a lot of extra credit. DO IT ALL.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Human Anatomy is hard, in the aspect that you have to MEMORIZE so MANY DETAILS. Finding a way to remember everything is key in this class. Do not take her 8am class, it's so hard to wake up in the morning, it also doesn't help when attendance isn't mandatory.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Her tests are so ridiculously hard, she flies through the information and basically is reading the powerpoint it's not interactive at all. the class itself is hard but she makes it much worse. i would suggest a different teacher. she does give 5 points extra credit for taking a post test quiz but when the class average tests are a 63 ....
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is a hard class, so you've got tot work for the grade. Read the textbook or you won't pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Completely Recommend!! I took her for both A&P 1 and 2. She's an amazing professor. She always answers questions and wants to make sure you understand if you show effort. Her tests can be tricky. Her grading material is super straightforward and she is transparent in letting you know what you need for your grade. I loved her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Amazing lectures

comment: A lot of people are complaining about Nowak, but she gives you all the materials and all the help you need to succeed in a tough class. Her lectures are clear and she will clarify anything if you ask her. Most of the stuff you will be tested on is on her power points, so if you know those you're good to go. Just work hard and ask for help.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Read the book, know info inside and out, have hours and hours to study, dont have any other life obligations, make sure your good at taking long test in record time.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: A lot of material covered quickly, she flies through her brief PowerPoints,test very detailed info, felt like very little guidance was given on what to focus on, study questions are very broad. Essentially, if you memorize the whole book you may do ok.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Nowak is an amazing Anatomy professor. I have had her for lab this past semester and it has been great. She goes at a good pace and allows for plenty of time to study the models. Always happy to answer questions. The class is hard because the material is hard. However, if you come to every lab and study a lot, you should be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: You must read the textbook because only pictures are discussed in class. Also, GO TO SI SESSIONS.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Nowak is one of my favorite teachers at KSU, she is kind and really cares about students. If you take the time and actually do the work then you will do well. She was great about helping when you ask her too! Just an excellent teacher on such a hard course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: This class is not easy but I wouldn't have chosen any other professor. I took this class at my other school and made a C, with her I made a B! She's pretty fair if you just study! 3 extra credit opps (5 points each). Go to lecture, study slides, do hw, skim over book and you are SET! would have made an A if I didn't slack on the 2nd test!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's tough! If you don't read and skip her class, you will fail. Her tests are HARD. She goes into detail on her tests, if you don't know for sure your going o fail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Honestly Dr. Nowak isn't a bad teacher. The class is incredibly hard so you need to be prepared and study regardless of who you take. She just does lectures so make sure you print out her power points and bring to class for notes. My struggle was busting my butt to pass the class but ending up not doing as well as I'd hoped on tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Reading most of these negative reviews makes me think they didnt read the book? A&P is a very difficult subject but if you study, read the textbook, and do all the HW on Mastering this class wont be as difficult. I spent tons of time studying but she offers extra credit. Her learning objectives dont help, just read from the book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I would suggest taking her MWF 50 minute class. The information is more spread out and it gives you more time to study it. She is very clear cut about the information. I would suggest reading the book, it helps! Also she takes questions off of Mastering AP HW and the study quizzes provided by Mastering AP for test. DOES care about her students!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She's nice and cares about students; she tells about how many stations per topic will be on practicals so you can gauge your studying. Homework was online quizzes and you got two chances to take them, with the answers given between each. Study what she gives you and take notes during her mini lecture. You really have to try to not do well.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's the most difficult professor I've ever encountered, DO NOT TAKE HER!!! So yeah she "cares" about her students but it sure doesn't seem like it. I was so psyched about learning anatomy but I quickly learned that she's more interested in showing off how smart she is than teaching. She doesn't teach, just talks and her tests are super confusing

You have to study to do well in anatomy & physiology no matter what. Dr. Nowak gives extensive learning objectives. If you write out the answers to each and use as a study guide, you'll be able to make an A. Her tests are tricky, so you have to understand the material, not just be familiar with it. She is very nice and wants students to do well.

A&P II lab is designed exactly like A&P I and this professor has absolutely no control over the exams (they are standard for the entire department). She was very helpful and engaging during labs, but you have to take pics and videos to study, because knowing the models is essential for passing. It's a lot of work, but it's doable.

Such a nice, intelligent professor, but very tough class!!! Shes very helpful when reviewing tests during office hours. I recommend reading the key concepts in mastering a and p study area to learn the material prior to attending lecture, or youll be lost. Final exam is cumilative but very general.  I luckily pulled out an A in her class.

Took her for both Lecture and Lab. Labs are pretty standard for all A&P classes, just do well on the 2 practicals. Her lecture though was tough. She flies through the powerpoints and doesn't post them online. Her tests are hard and confusing. She can be helpful if you stop by her office hours, but I would just choose another professor if I were you

Most of the class failed midterm except for a couple kids and some who had taken it previously and had to drop. Doesn't curve. Only midterm and final worth 42.5% of your grade. 100+ question tests. Multiple choice but there was always an option for "E) None of the above" for all of them. Class average on midterms extremely low. She's nice though

She is a very pleasant person and really cares about the students but other than that, she doesn't post Powerpoints. She hardly curves and refuses to in the lab. She got mad when a lot of the class got A's on a test. Who gets mad when her class does well?!  If you aren't prepared for the lab tests, you might have to withdrawl, lots of people did.
great teacher, gives list of everything you need to know for all the tests, very accurate list. good explainer, very helpful during office hours

Anatomy is hard no matter who your professor is. Dr Nowak is extremely sweet and knowledgable of the subject. Her lectures go fast but she is very good at teaching. She posts learning objectives which help. Tests are hard because there is so much material to know. Overall, great, but you have to work so hard to even make a B on tests

Professor Nowak makes A&P interesting and relatable. At least once every class period, a light bulb clicked in my head where things my body did made sense! If you take Professor Nowak, it won't be easy, but I can guarantee that you will learn how amazing the Human Anatomy truly is. She will also work with you and help you if you want to succeed.

Very smart woman but expects us to somehow memorize everything she says in her lecture and understand Her lecture like review because she flies through them. Tons of material for test every two weeks, slides are just pictures from the book that she explains, tests ARE HARD and complicated. Makes tests even harder if class does well on previous test

This prof. is sweet and tries her best to get students to understand, but I think her knowledge gets the best of her. Her tests are very wordy and she expects us to know what she is talking about when she lectures. She flies through the powerpoints and does not put them online. She gives a test every 2 weeks which i found hard finding time to study

Now is a really intelligent woman, she knows what she's talking about however, she's very unclear when lecturing. She'll give a lot of context to the material and when people ask if it will be on the exam, she doesn't say yes or no. She FLIES through the powerpoint and DOES NOT put them on d2L. Tests are hard because of the way she asks questions.

She has super hard test because of the wording. If you go to her during her office hours she will help you, but sometimes the way she speaks to you makes it sound like she's speaking to a Rocket Science. This subject is hard enough but she doesn't make it any easier.
